column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I have always been dumb to what is impossible .
#Text=So
#Text=I just figure how to do the “ impossible . ” I have been doing this all my life ! I am 61 .
#Text=I was born with cerebral palsy .
#Text=I communicate using a laser-pointer and a board of letters , numbers and commonly-used words .
#Text=But I am the host of a popular public access TALK show .
#Text=Go figure it !
#Text=So now I am setting my sights , as president , on eliminating poverty , hunger , war , etc.
#Text=Impossible , eh ?
#Text=When I was born , doctors told my parents that I had no intelligence , that I had no future , that I would be best put into an institution and be forgotten .
#Text=So the struggle for freedom , and against the powers-that-be has been my life .
#Text=And it has been a continuous struggle , struggling with schools to let me in , etc.
#Text=I have always been a radical .

#Text=But that became obvious when I was 18 and invented my head pointer with which I type and communicate…I started writing political columns for the high school paper…as well as putting out an underground paper .
#Text=I was in the first special class placed on a regular high school campus so that the disabled students could be in regular classes and be a part of campus life .
#Text=I was involved in the civil rights and anti-war movements .
#Text=This was 1965…before it was popular to be against the Vietnam War .
#Text=In the school paper I got into a debate with a GI in Vietnam .
#Text=I was sat down and told that , because of my political philosophy and activities , I was hurting the chances of the disabled students who would come after me .
#Text=I replied that the goal was to get the rights for the disabled [ and for all people ] to be complete and equal…and that included the right to be political .
#Text=I would not surrender that , or any other , right .
#Text=So I started doing political columns for underground newspapers , joined Students for Democratic Society .
#Text=Did political pranks…such as rolling in my wheelchair into the Marines Recruiting Office to join , offering to push the BUTTON with my head pointer .
#Text=But after the Kent State killings , I switched from straight politics to art , performance , and community building as my tools for effecting social change .
#Text=In the early 90s I and five other performance artists were targeted by Sen. Jesse Helms in what is commonly seen as the first battle of the cultural wars .
#Text=This placed me in a great position to fight for our freedoms !
#Text=What is your current job ?
#Text=What skills or ideas do you bring from this position , or previous positions , that will benefit the Oval Office ?
#Text=“ Artist ” covers a lot of different “ jobs”…and “ performance artist ” is even vaguer ! I am a performance artist .
#Text=I work outside boxes , using improvisation to draw people into the state of community where they can reach their potential .
#Text=This is what I will do as President .
